visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the title 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart should have three data series: 'Product A', 'Product B', and 'Product C'. Each series should have data for the months of January to December. The x-axis should display the months, and the y-axis should display the sales figures. The chart should have a legend positioned to the right, vertically aligned in the middle, and laid out vertically. The chart should also have custom colors for each series: '#7cb5ec', '#434348', and '#90ed7d'. The chart should be styled using CSS, with a background color of '#f7f7f7' and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart titled 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart includes three data series: 'Product A', 'Product B', and 'Product C', each with sales data for the months of January to December. The x-axis displays the months, and the y-axis displays the sales figures. The chart uses custom colors for each series: '#7cb5ec' for 'Product A', '#434348' for 'Product B', and '#90ed7d' for 'Product C'. The legend is positioned to the right, vertically aligned in the middle, and laid out vertically. The chart is styled using CSS, with a background color of '#f7f7f7' and a margin of 50 pixels on all sides. The axes and labels are styled with a font size of 12px for labels and 14px for the y-axis title, both in a dark gray color (#333).
